amendatorysection.catchline: Grasshopper Control Cash Fund; created; deposits; expenditures; investment.
amendatorysection.para: The Department of Agriculture is authorized to collect money paid by participating ranchers as their estimated one-third share of the cost of conducting the control program. Such money shall be credited to the Grasshopper Control Cash Fund, which fund is hereby created. Federal funds paid to the department as the federal one-third share of the cost of the program shall be deposited in a federal fund specifically established for that purpose. All money in such funds shall be expended solely for the administration of the program authorized by sections 2-1068 to 2-1070. Any money in the Grasshopper Control Cash Fund available for investment shall be invested by the state investment officer pursuant to the Nebraska Capital Expansion Act and the Nebraska State Funds Investment Act.
